column2: pyper1, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I developed severe back pain after a car accident which aggravated an old injury to my back. I have been on vicodin now for about 6 mos. and have found pain relief to be sufficeint although there are those times when the pain stills expresses itself after taking the medication. I do not abuse my medication and often wait until I feel the first tendrills of pain before taking the vicodin. I believe that using the medication in this way has kept it effective for the long period that I have been taking it.

column2: greatzoron, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Have been taking Vicodin now for 10 years.  Was in a car accident and my knee was crushed.  The ONLY way I can work is to have some pain relief as I am in pain 24/7/365. That is reality.  We are addicts but it is so we can function and work.  I don't abuse any of the meds I take.  Have severe high blood pressure, which goes through the roof when I'm in pain.And I work in health care and see the best Dr's.  Hopefully I can last 10 more years and retire but I have to work.  Vicodin HP has been a god send for me.  Take it TID with Tramadol.  Don't be afraid to take pain meds. thats what they were invented for, people!!!!!  Plus my mood is so much better because I'm not focusing on the pain.  I can function and concentrate on the task at hand. Please get the addict word out of your head.  If you need to function, hold a job, be somewhat pain free (for chronic pain) this is a very good drug.  Oh and I guess I'm addicted to Blood pressure meds. as I have to take them also. ;)  Have also tried MS Contin timed release which was the best pain med ever but constipated me so bad I had to stop.OK story over.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have tried some different pain meds to manage my chronic back pain, and Vicodin HP seems to be the most effective for me. The med also helps me sleep through the night as it prevents me from waking up in severe pain every two hours.

column2: jl, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: i was started on 5/500 and after a year or so was switched to 10/325 which worked right away and gave no side affects, was nearly pain free with 2 to 3 a day, my doc has now switched me to fentanl patch and vic 5s, which does not work and has made me sick. i have a bulged disc and bone spur and base of my skull, also some scoliosis, also what started it all was , 2 bulged disc at L4-L5 , area with stenosis, which is causing severe lower back and leg pain and problems, also because of that i now have plantarfleciitis in both feet and tarsel tunnel in my left ankle , and last year ruptured my right calf muscle due to the severe tightness in my legs due to my back problem.the vic 10s have helped greatly for me to keep working, if my doc doesnt stop screwin with my med i will need to go on disability

column9: use as needed  did not use unless there was pain   it helped alot

column2: dave, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have 2 thoracic herniated discs. Since they are herniated towards the front, surgery is not an option. They went untreated without healing themselves for 3-5 years so it has damaged my spinal cord. When I complained to my Dr. about the pain, he treated me as if I was "drug-seeking". Years later an MRI revealed the damage. About 8 months ago I was given Vicodin 500 which was useless for a 225 lb man. My Dr. switched me to Vicodin HP and it has helped a lot. One thing I will say is it went through steps. For the first 3 months it took the pain away and I felt a "buzz" which I didn't like. The 3rd - 6th months it took the pain away without any side effects. Now It doesn't seem to help nearly as much but I fear increasing to anything else because I don't want to build to much of a tolerance at 35 yrs of age. I have faith that my discs will heal themselves, but if they don't I fear living life without medication to mask the pain. When I have a good day now and I don't take the Vicodin, I feel my pain intensify greatly. This is a good drug but you can build an immunity to it quickly which can lead to stronger things without willpower. I reccomend not taking anything unless you absolutely need it. I had severe pain before, nut not everyday. Now that I've been treated, rarely does a day go by that I don't experience severe pain.

column2: MICHAEL C., 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I INITIALY STARTED WITH VICODIN 7.5/750mg. 5 TIMES A DAY FROM A HERNIATED DISC, THAT I HAD SUFFERED FROM AN INJURY AT WORK. I THEN DEVELOPED SPONDYLOSIS OF THE LOWER LUMBAR SPINE, (3 VERTABRAES)RESULTING IN 4 HERNIATED DISCS. AT WHICH THEN I WAS SWITCHED TO VICODIN H.P. 20mg. 3 TIMES A DAY FOR THE PAST 10 YEARS. JUST OVER A YEAR AGO I WAS INVOLVED IN A SEVERE MOTORCYCLE ACCIDENT, THAT RESULTED IN MANY BROKEN BONES,INCLUDING 2 FRACTURED NECK VERTABRAE'S,CRUSHED EYE SOCKETS,AND MULTIPLE ROAD RASH SKIN REMOVAL. I ENDED UP WITH A TOTAL OF SEVEN SURGERIES, INCLUDING FACIAL RECONSTRUCTION,COLLAR BONE TITANIUM PLATE INSTALLATION, AND RECOVERY FROM 4 BROKEN RIBS. ALONG WITH CHRONIC PAIN MANAGEMENT THAT INVOLVES TAKING MS CONTIN.(EXTENDED RELEASE MORPHINE SULFATE)100mg. 2 TIMES A DAY. THE VICODIN H.P. PROVIDES ME WITH WONDERFUL BREAK THROUGH PAIN MANAGEMENT.AS I HAD SAID, I TAKE 20mg. OF VICODIN H.P. EVERY 4-6 HOURS AS NEEDED. ALTHOUGH THE MEDICINE DOES PROVIDE EXCELLENT PAIN REDUCTION FOR BREAK THROUGH PAIN, IT DOES NOT GIVE ME THE "DRUGGED UP" DIZZENESS THAT OTHER BREAK THROUGH PAIN MEDICATIONS CAUSED.I.E;ROXICODONE OR PERCOCET. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE VICODIN H.P. FOR EITHER BREAK THROUGH PAIN MANAGEMENT, OR COMPLETE PAIN RELIEF MANAGEMENT ON IT'S OWN, TO ANYONE WHO IS SEEKING PAIN RELIEF, WITHOUT THE "DRUGGED UP"FEELING THAT OTHER MEDICINE'S MAY CAUSE.IT IS SIMPLEY A WONDERFUL PAIN RELIEVING MEDICATION.............
